lines.text: And it ain't a fit night out for man nor beast.
Once the city gets into a ba-hoy's sa-histem, he a-loses his a-hankerin', for the ca-huntry.
I think I'll go milk the elk.
He wants more money and if he don't get it, he'll take our malamutes.
He won't take old Balto, my lead dog.
He was mighty good with mustard.
My Uncle Ichabod said, speakin' of the city, "It ain't no place for a woman, gal, but pretty men go thar."

[trying to play moose call]
My old embouchure isn't what it used to be.
I feel so tired, I think I'll go to bed.
Why don't you lie down and take a little rest first, Chester?

[gagging on the artificial snow]
Tastes more like corn flakes!
Our Chester never stole nothin' from nobody - hardly ever!

[to the Canadian Mountie in a blizzard]
Is it still snowing, Officer Posthlewhistle?

[during the middle of a blizzard]
Be sure to open your window a little bit before you go to bed.
I will, Pa, and Ma, remember to open your window a little bit before you go to bed.
